c

FUNCNAME

c

c
$BASH_VERSION` | Bash version string `$BASH_VERSINFO
| An array of 6 elements with Bash version information
c

c

| Real (not effective if different) User ID of the process running
c
bash
$PS1` | Primary command line prompt; see [Using the PS\* Variables](http://stackoverflow.com/documentation/bash/7541/handling-the-system-prompt#t=201610212316553697922) `$PS2
| Secondary command line prompt (used for additional input)
c
$PS3` | Tertiary command line prompt (used in select loop) `$PS4
| Quaternary command line prompt (used to append info with verbose output)
c

| Variable used by
c
read

c
select
to return the user-supplied value
c
$PIPESTATUS` | Array variable that holds the exit status values of each command in the most recently executed foreground pipeline.

title: Variable Assignment must have no space before and after. a=123 not a = 123. The latter (an equal sign surrounded by spaces) in isolation means run the command a with the arguments = and 123, though it is also seen in the string comparison operator (which syntactically is an argument to \[ or [[ or whichever test you are using).

inline_content.Text: Variable Assignment must have no space before and after. a=123 not a = 123. The latter (an equal sign surrounded by spaces) in isolation means run the command a with the arguments = and 123, though it is also seen in the string comparison operator (which syntactically is an argument to \[ or [[ or whichever test you are using).
